intro: Hieracium ostenfeldii, commonly known as the Ostenfeld's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a perennial species that can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
